meanings.definition: Producing or capable of producing money
meanings.sent1: The new business venture proved to be moneymaking, bringing in steady profits.
meanings.sent2: Investing in real estate can be a moneymaking opportunity for those looking to grow their wealth.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pet rock may seem silly, but it turned out to be surprisingly moneymaking.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic talent was a moneymaking machine, turning her passion into a lucrative career.
meanings.sent5: The moneymaking potential of the stock market attracted many eager investors.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to the making of money
meanings.sent1: The moneymaking strategies discussed in the meeting aimed to boost company profits.
meanings.sent2: She took on a moneymaking project to save up for her dream vacation.
meanings.sent3: The moneymaking scheme they came up with was both clever and risky.
meanings.sent4: His moneymaking ideas were always innovative, setting him apart in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The moneymaking opportunities in the city attracted ambitious entrepreneurs.

meanings.sent1: The small bakery turned out to be a surprisingly moneymaking business.
meanings.sent2: She saw the potential in the moneymaking venture and decided to invest.
meanings.sent3: Their moneymaking scheme was so successful, it exceeded all expectations.
meanings.sent4: The moneymaking deal they struck brought in substantial profits for both parties.
meanings.sent5: The moneymaking nature of the industry made it a desirable field for many.
